page.title: 11Winster , activities
page.content: There are approximately 30 houses with permanent residents in Winster, but very few children. Some people are over 80, but on the whole, live with their relatives. In the area persists, and are noted on the war memorial and on the gravestones and memorial tablets in the church. Many of these are lakeland names, dervied from the Scandinavian or earlier settlers, for example, Postlethwaite has 'thwaite' - clearing in the forest etc. It should be noted that the retired "off-comers" bring the extra interests to the locals, this is evident from the village gall noticeboard, which advertises so many types of meeting, Historical Society, bingo, Gardeners Club, Red Cross, and others, as well as coffee mornings and fetes.
